ermhes82 wrote:
> Hi,
> 
> I´m trying to login in a Html Form with Heritrix 2.0 but I cannot. I
> have revissed other questions in this mailing list and I have tried to
> login against the following URIs that I´ve seend:
> https://www.redhat.com/wapps/sso/login.html
> http://www.mangosproject.org/forum/index.php?act=Login&CODE=00
> 
> In RedHat login form I´ve logged without problemas but in
> MangosProject I can not. My settings for MangosProject are:
> 
> credential-domain=string, www.mangosproject.org
> form-items=map, java.lang.String
> form-items:referer=string,
> http://www.mangosproject.org/forum/index.php?s=39cdfa6d9ef87327a4c732b03e169325&amp;act=Login&amp;CODE=01&amp;CookieDate=1
> form-items:UserName=string, myuser
> form-items:PassWord=string, mypass
> form-items:CookieDate=string, 1
> form-items:submit=string, Log me in
> form-method=string, POST
> login-uri=string,
> http://www.mangosproject.org/forum/index.php?act=Login&CODE=00
> 
> What is happening?
> I have seen that in this URI are two forms, this has anything to do?

I suspect the 'referer' value may be an issue.

The 's' parameter looks like a session value that is likely to have 
expired by the time the crawler tries its login.

Also, the '&' encoding is likely an artifact of the place where you 
copied the value. Including it in the login-form-submission may confuse 
the server.

I made a test account, and left off the 'referer' and 'submit' 
form-items entirely, and seemed to login OK. (I was redirected back to 
the forums entry page, and the HTML showed me 'logged in as' my test 
account name.

Hope this helps,

- Gordon @ IA
